name: sfchronicle
text: PG&E officials said Saturday that the utility is not planning to initiate a Public Safety Power Shutoff related to the upcoming weather system — which prompted a red flag warning — “because the conditions do not meet our rigorous thresholds for doing so.” https://t.co/v0WooUxtXs

name: sfchronicle
text:
What's causing the Bay Area's fire-starting lightning storms? They're the product of tropical moisture heading into the region. 

A forecast of more possible storms this weekend is linked to the remnants of Hurricane Genevieve in the Baja Peninsula. 

https://t.co/qqQ2Re18xa

name: sfchronicle
text:
Many things have to go right in a long winning streak, and the A’s run of nine consecutive wins at home ended Saturday due in part to an unusual flaw for them: defense.

https://t.co/CnsuKOyTOR

name: sfchronicle
text:
Cal Fire shares phone numbers for residents to call to get information on local complex fires:

- CZU: 831-335-6717 (211 for San Mateo County) 
- LNU:  707-967-4207 
- SCU: 916-618-3195 or 669-247-7431
- Butte/Tehama:  530-538-7826 

https://t.co/HpP8X6RPMg

name: sfchronicle
text: Among the casualties of the #LNULightningComplex fires are many of the farms in Vacaville’s Pleasants Valley, a unique agricultural community with lots of small-scale, family-owned businesses. https://t.co/U8eimq0aaN

name: sfchronicle
text: The arrival of destructive wildfires is aligning with the beginning of harvest, and that presents a much larger threat to the wine industry: Could 2020’s grapes burn on the vine before anyone can pick them? https://t.co/CLQiiTBrQI

name: sfchronicle
text: By now, California winemakers are accustomed to dealing with fire season in conjunction with harvest season, their busiest and most critical time of year. But 2020 is different. https://t.co/1gQsCMbfat

name: sfchronicle
text:
These state parks and forests in Santa Cruz County will be closed starting Sunday due to fire danger:

- Soquel Demonstration State Forest
- Portions of The Forest of Nisene Marks State Park

https://t.co/khZVCSZyND

name: sfchronicle
text:
New evacuation orders issued for the Carmel and River fires: 

- All areas east of Carmel Valley Road, south from Finch Creek to Arroyo Seco Road 
- All areas west of River Road/Fort Romie Road/Arroyo Seco Road extending south to Elm Ave/Arroyo Seco Road

https://t.co/Pry86x5AjV

name: sfchronicle
text:
Cal Fire announces more evacuation warnings in Alameda County including:

- South of the Livermore City limits
- East of Curtner Rd south along I-680 to the Santa Clara County line
- South of Highway 84 in-between Vineyard Avenue and I-680

Full list: https://t.co/ZV0pex9udz

name: sfchronicle
text:
Latest on the #CZULightningComplex fires, from Cal Fire:

- 67,000 acres
- 5% contained
- 115 structures destroyed
- 24,300 structures threatened
- 1,349 firefighters battling the blaze 

Follow live updates here: https://t.co/3VPnCJIFme

name: sfchronicle
text:
Latest numbers on the biggest Northern California wildfires: 

#SCULightningComplex: 339,968 acres burned, 10% contained

#LNULightningComplex: 325,128 acres burned, 15% contained

See the scope of the blazes on our Fire Tracker: https://t.co/JrvvvptEIT https://t.co/Kbhp5xVlBc

name: sfchronicle
text:
A’s players received a nice surprise on Saturday afternoon when their starting lineup was announced by family members before their game against the Angels at the Coliseum.

https://t.co/uVnaMuIzYP

name: sfchronicle
text: The Marin County Fire Department said firefighters are responding to a "series of fires in the area above" Indian Valley College in Novato. Officials are asking people to avoid the area. No evacuations have been issued at this time. https://t.co/WO7dt7tvVr

name: sfchronicle
text:
Our Air Quality Map shows in real time:
- Locations of #LNULightningComplex, #CZULightningComplex, Bay Area fires
- Wind direction/speeds
- Air quality data from local sensors
- Smoke forecast
So you can assess how fires are affecting conditions near you. https://t.co/ebGMSbiTrO https://t.co/Bm1wuANZjO

name: sfchronicle
text: Marin County sheriff’s officials said Novato police are searching for a person who is “considered armed and dangerous in the area of the series of fires” that firefighters are battling near the College of Marin Indian Valley Campus. https://t.co/oc4ZYRvtEU

name: sfchronicle
